course_title: Topics in Afr American Studies: The Great Reverse Migration
seats: Seats: Maximum Enrollment: 12 / Seats Avail: 8Waitlist Total: 0
class_notes:
(Same as HIST 396 1)
(This course explores the history and ongoing impact of the Great Reverse Migration the mass migration of African Americans to the American South in the wake of the Civil Rights Movement. The course will begin by exploring the history of the American South since 1965, including urbanization, immigration, the rise of the black middle class, and the issue of southern exceptionalism. Students will conduct primary source based final projects on the Great Reverse Migration.)
course_description: This course explores one of a wide range of topics pertaining to the African American experience in the fields of human and civil rights, social and literary texts, and the social sciences.
sections: Class Nbr: 1513, Section #: 7, Type: LEC, Campus: ATL, Meets: MW 4-5:15p, Instructor: B. Adams, Status: Open
